intro: Chaetanthera minuta, commonly known as the slender chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the fruits are small, dry, and winged. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils.
